head.title: National Briefing | South: Georgia: Indictment In Privacy Case

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | South: Georgia: Indictment In Privacy Case

abstract.p: Federal grand jury in Atlanta, Ga, indicts former employee of Internal Revenue Service Michael Sapp on charges of selling information from accounts of more than 40 taxpayers in 1999 and 2000 (S)

block.p: A federal grand jury indicted a former employee of the Internal Revenue Service in Atlanta on charges of selling information from the accounts of more than 40 taxpayers in 1999 and 2000, according to the office of the United States attorney. Prosecutors said the employee, Michael Sapp, 44, took the identities of taxpayers' dependents from a database and gave the information to acquaintances, who used it to apply for fraudulent tax refunds. Mr. Sapp is charged with unauthorized access to a government computer.
